title: Fully encrypted "confCons.xml" become decrypted after opening in the upgraded version for the first time
author: yderi
body_snippet:
Hi everyone.

If you choose to completely encrypt connection file, it stays fully encrypted until you open it in a new version of the application. It makes a backup copy of the current file (where content is still encrypted) and after closing app, it saves connection file in decrypted condition (Yes passwords stay in some form of hash,  but everything else is visible).
The same behavior for 1.76.15 and 1.76.11 and so on.
It can be fixed by choosing again to completely encrypt connection file...

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
App settings are saved in the same folder as the portable exe file. If you do not copy the settings file over to the new directory, the setting for encrypting the entire connection file will not be enabled in your new version of the app. (I believe that is what is happening here, but please correct me if I'm wrong.)

That being said, I agree that this is an issue. The solution would be to manage the "full encryption" setting within the connection file itself, rather than making it a global app...

comments.author: yderi
comments.snippet:
Yes, you are right.
I'm not moving app settings "mRemoteNG.exe.config" file to a new portable directory, that why it happens to me.
So, I agree, it would be nice to store "full encryption" setting within the connection file itself.
So if program see a FullFileEncryption="true"
parameter and its options in connection file, it must use it instead of app setting file. Or might be better, at all, store and use it in a single place - connection file, to maintain security.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
> store and use it in a single place - connection file

That is probably what we would go with. It would be too confusing to have a global app setting *and* a per-connection file setting.
